rref

public static Matrix rref(Matrix matrix)
Returns a new Matrix object in the row reduced echelon form.

Parameters:
the - matrix to be reduced
Returns:
the row reduced form of the matrix

solveSystem

public static double[] solveSystem(double[][] sys)
Solves the given system of linear equations an returns a solution vector. Note that the matrix must be in augmented form for this reason the number of rows + 1 must be equal to the number of columns.

Parameters:
the - system to be solved
Returns:
the solution vector or null in case that the system is not in the correct form

isLinearDependent

public static boolean isLinearDependent(javax.vecmath.Vector3d vector1,
                                        javax.vecmath.Vector3d vector2)
Returns true if the two vectors are linear dependent otherwise false. This method calculates the vector product of the two given vectors and checks its length. In case the length is 0.0 the two given vectors are linear dependent otherwise not.

Parameters:
vector - parameter 1
vector - parameter 2
Returns:
true if vectors are linear dependent otherwise false

round

public static double round(double num,
                           int significant)

getPointsOnSphere

public static javax.vecmath.Point3d[] getPointsOnSphere(javax.vecmath.Point3d point1,
                                                        javax.vecmath.Point3d point2,
                                                        double scale)
                                                 throws NoPointOnSphereException
Returns an array of two Point3D objects which lie on the bounding sphere. The returned points are the intersection of the line going trough the two given points and the bounding sphere. Note that object refers to a line or a plane in the context of the two point parameters.

Parameters:
point - on the object
point - on the object
Returns:
array of two Point3D objects
Throws:
NoPointOnSphereException - in case the points do not intersect the sphere or the line going through them is tangential to the sphere
